arts.ttl: ‘We’re not ready to win the Scudetto yet’ – Gasperini on Atalanta’s ambitions
arts.sum: Atalanta secured an impressive 2-0 away victory against Stuttgart in the Champions League, with Ademola Lookman and Nicolo Zaniolo finding the back of the net. Following the match, manager Gian Piero Gasperini shared his thoughts on the team’s performance and their prospects for the season. Gasperini began by highlighting the team’s ambition: “We came here with ambition, but winning is another matter. These stadiums are beautiful. We were coming off a great victory, today we suffered a bit in the end, but these Champions League matches are a reason for growth and give us confidence.” The Atalanta boss emphasized the The post ‘We’re not ready to win the Scudetto yet’ – Gasperini on Atalanta’s ambitions appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.sum: Watch highlights as goals from Ademola Lookman and former Aston Villa forward Nicolo Zaniolo give Atalanta a 2-0 victory over Stuttgart to maintain their unbeaten start to the Champions League season.

arts.ttl: Champions League | Stuttgart 0-2 Atalanta: Match Report
arts.sum: Atalanta continued their impressive form with a well-deserved 2-0 Champions League victory away at VfB Stuttgart. Goals from Ademola Lookman and Nicolò Zaniolo sealed the win for the Italian side, who have now extended their unbeaten run across all competitions. The match began with both teams showing attacking intent. Mario Pasalic came close for Atalanta early on, while Stuttgart’s Roualt missed a golden opportunity from a corner. Atalanta suffered an early setback when Sead Kolasinac was forced off with an injury, replaced by Odilon Kossounou. arts.ttl: Lookman strikes again as Bergamo defeat Stuttgart
arts.sum: Former RB Leipzig man Ademola Lookman has once again taken out a German club in a European club competition. Sebastian Hoeneß' VfB Stuttgart dropped their fourth 2024/25 UCL fixture against Atalanta Bergamo at home.
Ademola Lookman, héroe y MVP en la última Europa League, dio tres puntos vitales a los de Bérgamo en Stuttgart. Zaniolo sentenció al final.
